summary: This is an email chain from August 12, 2019, coordinating interviews of Bureau of Prisons personnel following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details the logistics for interviewing MCC staff, assigning FBI and OIG agents to specific interviewees, and mentions subpoenas for some employees.

persons.name: Sato
persons.context: Mentioned as needing an FBI agent to accompany him while he reviews technical components at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Coordination of BOP Personnel Interviews
events.description: Email coordination to conduct immediate interviews of Bureau of Prisons personnel, with some to be served subpoenas. Interviews are to be conducted on the 9th floor conference room or at residences to avoid press at MCC.

events.title: Epstein Needing a Cell Mate
events.description: Reference to an interviewee (#10) who wrote a memo regarding Epstein needing a cell mate, and another (#11) who was notified that Epstein needed a cellmate.

locations: 9th floor conference room (presumably at a USAO or FBI office)
MI (likely a typo or abbreviation for an interview location)
keyFacts: The email chain is dated August 12, 2019, immediately following Jeffrey Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, indicating the rapid launch of an investigation into the circumstances.
Interviews of Bureau of Prisons personnel were being urgently coordinated, with some employees to be served subpoenas.
Specific BOP staff were identified for interview, including one who wrote a memo about Epstein needing a cell mate and another who was notified of this need.
Efforts were made to interview staff away from MCC (at a 9th floor location or residences) to avoid the press camped out at the jail.
An agent named Sato required an FBI escort to review technical components at MCC, suggesting a forensic examination of the facility.
